comments.commentBody:
It seems like spontaneous, impulsive nonsense. But what if Trump has been getting whispers about wiretaps that show explicitly that he 1) got paid handsomely by the Russians for his Presidential run and the success he had; and 2) had multiple allies, surrogates and campaign bigwigs ordering up and exploiting information from Russian intelligence to defeat Hillary Clinton.

Because I think that is what is happening. And it is possible this was the strategy all along: set up a pretext for a power grab. Antagonize US intelligence, treat the media aggressively and provoke a response, then sweep them aside. It is an exercise in plausible deniability.

These are scary times.
No matter what you do, you can not change a spoiled child; they are the same at 70 as at 7.
I know for a fact, and I mean real fact, that aliens from outer space tapped Trump's phone for decades.  They pulled the taps after concluding there would be no sign of intelligent life.
Love this!!
Presidents don't tap phones. The intelligence agencies do.

This is the wrong argument - AG runs the DOJ, AG report to president who is the head of government. These things have to be initiated and approved - they don't spontaneously start as the result of an algorithm. At some point, in the words of Harry Truman - " the buck stops here".

It goes on and on.
And it does not bother him at all that Vlad listened in to all that he said.
Trump must be the worst thing that has happened, not alone to America, but to the whole western world.
We laugh and cringe when we see Kim Yun this and that.
Now we have our own source of ridicule.

This is the wrong argument - AG runs the DOJ, AG report to president who is the head of government. These things have to be initiated and approved - they don't spontaneously start as the result of an algorithm. At some point, in the words of Harry Truman - " the buck stops here".

I wonder if the crowd will be chanting "lock him up" at the next Trump campaign event.

A nice impeachment trial in the summer of '18 would go hugely well with a light Chardonnay from Trump winery.

This is the wrong argument - AG runs the DOJ, AG report to president who is the head of government. These things have to be initiated and approved - they don't spontaneously start as the result of an algorithm. At some point, in the words of Harry Truman - " the buck stops here".
Are you only just now shocked by Mr. Trump's lack of judgement? It's been on full display for quite some time.

"The Intelligence Community needs to have a very serious sit down with Trump & staff. They should explain exactly how they do their work and what is legal for both the Intelligence Community and for the White House."

I suspect that this has already occurred, and that Trump is angry with McGahn because the WH Counsel told him that no, he can't just order the intelligence community and the Justice Department to stop investigating and bury whatever they've turned up.

Todays episode of unrespectful behaviour of calling a former US president a "bad (or sick) guy marks the low point of an unworthy labeled current president. I am so sorry for the american people in general and i hope this marks the beginning of a downfall of something that never should have happened in the first place.

People associate wiretaps with organized crime and drug cartels.  But they are often used when the contents of private conversations are the only available evidence of serious criminal activity.  Drug offenses are the major target,   But in many conspiracies involving boilerplate crime, like insider trading and mail fraud, wiretaps are used.  Such taps are placed on telephones --- body wires are different -- and the principle of minimization requires that only relevant conversations be taped.  Wiretapping is heavy duty law enforcement, but it isn't cloak and dagger and should not be thought of as 1984-ish,

Michjas:

Thanks for your reasoned insights on this one.

I am clearly not as knowledgeable as you on this topic, but am also surprised that anyone is surprised, much less upset about this. It seems obvious that if the FBI was investigating Trump, they were probably using wiretaps to gather information.

It is time to acknowledge what has been apparent from the get go. This man is unstable, incompetent and can not remain President. Oh, and did I mention dangerous and heartless. Pence and Ryan are awful backups but one step at a time.
You begin to wonder if 45 is on some sort of mind control drug program, and that the drugs wear off at some time early morning when the urge to tweet is upon him.
Even assuming Trump is correct, is a nearly unintelligible tweet the way to make this accusation?  It makes him seem callous at best, unstable at worst.
The wires in Trump's brain are what need to be tapped by professionals, maybe they can fix something!

If there is no clear evidence that the Obama Administration initiated wire tapping on Mr. Trump's telephones at Trump Tower, these allegations are nothing but, fake news.
Will this lead to another investigation? If so, who will investigate whom? If there is going to be one, there will now be a clamor for a Select Committee or for an Independent Counsel. This will be interesting.
Assuming that this allegation holds no truth, it will be nothing but, another avenue to distract the ongoing controversy in the Trump Campaign - Russia saga.
While we wait for evidence on the telephone wire tapping allegation, Congress should appoint an Independent Counsel to conduct a complete investigation into the alleged Trump campaign connections to Russia.

Now that the skids have been greased to appoint (Merrick) Gorsuch to the Supreme Court, the GOP has gotten about all they need from DT, so it's about time to promote true conservative Pence to the Presidency before the rapidly unwinding Donald damages the party more than it can sustain through the next mid terms.

This isn't the lunacy that so many people in social media and even here claim it to be.  It's part of a calculated strategy that, while Trump is too stupid to concoct, is planned and executed by his inner circle to change the conversation whenever the real evils, conflicts, incompetence or genuine lunacy takes charge of the national conversation about this abominable crew in the White House as the Russian connections and Sessions have done of late.
Too bad the person who received the most votes by the American people can't take the reins.

Has Trump ever shown a shocking excess of judgement?

What was that he was saying though, about anonymous sources the other day?

But that was the other day.
I've been noticing that shift since reagan started destroying our government to allow this mess to happen.

There is no doubt now whatsoever that despite all that has happened in the ongoing saga of the "Trump Gong Show",  if he stated that he has proof the moon is made of cheese, his supporters would believe him.
Exactly right, so why hasn't Trump backed up his assertions with facts?

Like a little boy, whatever is said about him (with proof) he says it right back (without proof). I am so tired of the scattershot techniques, his obvious mental health issues and in gratitude to the researchers bringing forward this treasonous information. My hope is that we have a new election with no electoral vote to do this EVER again. He is out of control with no center core and appears to have all the hallmarks of a dictator.
Cyprus
